column4: Can someone help me install Wubi? I need help with partitioning
what is the problem?
zenithdk_, I have Windows XP and I want to dual boot Ubuntu 10.10 to it
yeah? so run Wubi and have it make a container, no need to reformat
In the installation I can either erase whole drive (don't want this) or specify partitions manually
how do I re-add the "presence" applet? it seems to have crashed and have not started again - I need it to logon to my accounts
have you booted into Windows?
I have windows xp already installed and I have used it , and now I want to install Ubuntu using the LiveCD
so have you booted up on the Live CD into Ubuntu or are you in Windows?
I am now using Ubuntu through the LiveCD and I want to install it
I just wanted to know if you were running Ubuntu, or were in Windows, you are in Ubuntu, right
so for the partitioning, have it create a 40GB partition for Ubuntu
Right now I am chatting with you using Ubuntu
so it just needs to resize your existing partition, which version of Ubuntu are you running? I thought newer installers assumed this by themselves
10.10. I don't have an option to automatically install alongside current OS
I think if you run Wubi from Windows it should ask you that, to resize your existing partition
ok, then just shrink your existing partition
I am not using Wubi! I am using the LiveCD
rigth, but you mentioned Wubi at the start :P I think if you boot into Windows Wubi or something like it can be run from Windows to start the install also
but regardless, can you make out how to configure it to resize the partition?
I am using already 4 prime partitions, I think, Can I add another partition?
aaaarh, that is another issue, you can only have 4 primary partitions, you need to make an "extended" partition if I remember correctly
I heared I need to make an extended partition, but I have no idea how to
